intro: Pavetta sansibarica subsp. trichosphaera, commonly known as the East African pavetta, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal forests and rocky outcrops. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and clustered in terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
